New Records: The Cardinals hit four home runs, including back-to-back shots from Lars Nootbaar and Paul Goldschmidt in the first inning, marking the first time this season they had consecutive homers.
Paul Goldschmidt took over the team lead with his 22nd home run of the season.
Key Match Events: A five-run inning by the Rockies turned the game in their favor after the Cardinals had tied the game at 8-8.
Pre-Game Insights: The Cardinals were trying to sweep a series in Colorado for the first time since 2004 and were aiming to match their season-high five-game winning streak.
Cardinals relievers had combined to allow only one run over six innings in the first two games of the series.
Post-Match Reflections: The loss snapped a four-game winning streak for the Cardinals.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was the third time this season the Cardinals lost a game despite scoring eight or more runs.
